text: Helène Aylon (born Helene Greenfield; February 4, 1931 - April 6, 2020) was an American multimedia and ecofeminist artist.Debra Nussbaum Cohen, "The Liberation of Helène Aylon," Forward (13 July 2012).Helène Aylon, Whatever Is Contained Must Be Released: My Jewish Orthodox Girlhood, My Life as a Feminist Artist (New York: Feminist Press, 2012). She was born in New York City. Her works were divided into three phases: process art (1970s), anti-nuclear art (1980s), and The G-d Project (1990s and early 2000s). She also created a feminist commentary on the Hebrew Bible. In 2012 Aylon published Whatever Is Contained Must Be Released: My Jewish Orthodox Girlhood, My Life as a Feminist Artist. Aylon died on April 6, 2020 of COVID-19 in New York City at the age of 89.Helène Aylon, Eco-Feminist Artist Who Pondered Change, Is Dead at 89 of Coronavirus-Related Causes ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American feminist writers Category:American artists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New York City Category:Writers from New York City
title: Helène Aylon
